text: Does the new built-in HubSpot Search do a full-text search in HubDB tables?
it only searches pages. it will not return results for HubDB entries that are not in a page, because there’d be no where to link to

Here's my scenario ... For the HubSpot Dev {{ code }} Gallery (launching Q1) developers will submit entries.

Each entry will include title, description, GitHub Repo, etc. = all stored in HubDB table.

Each entry will have a public facing page / URL that pulls from the HubDB table.
-----
A website visitor searches for a term (in HubSpot site search) ... that term is in the entry's description ... would the entry's page display in the search results?
It treats dynamic pages generated from HubDB tables as normal site pages and searches that
sweeet - that's good news. :slightly_smiling_face: Thanks for clarifying yall.
cool to know you’re dogfooding that site
of course! We're using HubSpot CMS for as much as humanly possible for the {{ code }} Gallery. It's going to make a great case study.
the submission process is one are though, where you’re going to have to roll something custom.
Yup, GitHub + HubSpot API's + custom form
